Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: Patient expresses feelings of anxiety and depression, mentions difficulty finding full-time employment, and aspires to be a recording singer.
Trauma History: Patient has been diagnosed with PTSD within the last year and a half, reflecting on past situations that have impacted their future.
History of Present Illness (HPI): Patient reports feeling anxious while searching for stable housing but is currently calmer.
Medical and Psychiatric History: Patient has been diagnosed with depression and is currently attending therapy, which they believe is beneficial.
Psychosocial History: Patient shares their background, including living arrangements, educational history as an English major, and positive influences in their life such as family and friends.
Physiological Observations: Patient experiences sleep disturbances related to stress and anxiety, leading to irritability.
Current Functional Status: Patient is currently engaged in yoga and is working towards completing their education.
Progress Evaluation: Patient acknowledges improvements in managing anxiety and stress through therapy, noting that discussing issues helps relieve tension.
Therapeutic Interventions: Continued therapy sessions are recommended to support the patient in managing their mental health.
